description: How suitable is a particular area or piece of land for farming? This category helps users understand this. In particular it displays the ‘Agricultural Land Classification’ - a determination of the suitability of the land for agriculture. The five grades are assessed by a consistent set of criteria which include climate, site-specific information and soil quality. Grade 1 is classed as the best quality land, grade 5 being the poorest.
intro: Knowing the potential of the land is crucial to determining what you can grow, and where. The datasets in this section were chosen to provide insight into the soil and potential for agriculture. This information can be used to identify suitable land for food growing, forestry and horticulture, among others. We aim to add further information about soil and other key characteristics in the future.
outro: Still haven’t found what you’re looking for? We plan to integrate more soil information in future versions, along with information on historic productivity. If you have other ideas on what we should include, please fill in this short form.

datasets.name: Agricultural Land Classification
datasets.description: Agricultural land classified into five grades. Grade one is best quality and grade five is poorest quality. A number of consistent criteria used for assessment which include climate (temperature, rainfall, aspect, exposure, frost risk), site (gradient, micro-relief, flood risk) and soil (depth, structure, texture, chemicals, stoniness).

datasets.name: National Forest Estate soils
datasets.description: This Forestry Commission dataset provides detailed soil information for the Public Forest Estate within all of Scotland and parts of England and Wales. This soil classification system was created by foresters specifically to serve silviculture, and thus distinguishes soil on the basis of drainage and nutrition. It only covers land owned by the Forestry Commission.

datasets.name: Exploring Land Data
datasets.description: Shared Assets believes that quality information on land can help people make better decisions about how to use land for the common good. For some in the sector, access to good, open data could mean the difference between success and failure. This report outlines where land data is currently collated and kept, why it is inaccessible to common good land users, and how to change this for the better.

datasets.name: Soilscapes (platform)
datasets.description: Soilscapes is a 1:250,000 scale, simplified soils dataset covering England and Wales. It was created from the more detailed National Soil Map (NATMAPvector) with the purpose of effectively communicating a general understanding of the variations which occur between soil types, and how soils affect the environment.

datasets.name: MySoil
datasets.description: MySoil gives you access to a comprehensive European soil properties map within a single app. Discover what lies beneath your feet and help us to build a community dataset by submitting your own soil information.

datasets.name: UKSO Soils Map Viewer
datasets.description: The UKSO soils map viewer/ resource combines loads of different soil quality datasets, some of which are downloadable.

datasets.name: Farming Futures Interactive Map
datasets.description: Use the interactive map to discover case studies, factsheets and events relating to farming in your region.

datasets.name: The Food Assembly
datasets.description: The Food Assembly brings together people to buy fresh food directly from local farmers and foodmakers. If you are interested in growing or producing food for market, their map allows you to check your proximity to a food assembly, and get involved as a producer.

description: Knowing the likelihood of flooding is crucial to developing projects. This category displays flood risk data from the Environment Agency. It shows you the likelihood of flooding in a given area by taking into account historic instances of flooding and current flood defences, as well as proximity to rivers, groundwater springs and the sea.
intro: Understanding flood risk is crucial to finding a site, identifying where to develop infrastructure, and knowing what to prepare for. It is also a key feature of local environments that people should know about. There is a lot of excellent data about flooding openly available, and this page hosts some of the best data.

datasets.name: Historic Flood Map
datasets.description: Historic Flood Map is a map layer showing land that has flooded in the past. It displays the maximum extent of all individual Recorded Flood Outlines from river, the sea and groundwater springs and shows areas of land that have previously been subject to flooding in England.

datasets.name: Risk of Flooding from Rivers and Sea
datasets.description: This is a national assessment of flood risk for England produced using local expertise. The dataset shows the chance of flooding from rivers and/or the sea. Each cell is allocated one of four flood risk categories, taking into account flood defences and their condition.

datasets.name: Flood Map for Planning
datasets.description: This website maps flood data. Click on the map to see what Flood Zone (National Planning Policy Guidance definitions) a proposed development is in.

datasets.name: UK Flood Risk and Flood Management: Open Data Discovery Guide
datasets.description: This guide is intended to help potential data users find public datasets about flood risk and flood management.

datasets.name: Check my Flood Risk
datasets.description: This website uses Environment Agency data to highlight likelihood of flooding from rivers and sea

datasets.name: Flood risk assessment and advice
datasets.description: This tool shows how likely flooding is for a particular area, describes factors that influence the likelihood, and gives information about managing flood risk.

datasets.name: UK Rainfall App
datasets.description: These applications allow users to create interactive maps of gridded monthly and daily rainfall, showing the variation of rainfall across the country and through time.

datasets.name: Open spreadsheet matching information needs to available land data
datasets.description: This google sheet matches the needs of land users to available data. Land Explorer has been developed using this resource and the research that went into it. Visitors can contribute new datasets and platforms for viewing them.

description: Planning restrictions are designed to prevent damage to valuable land. Each restriction is associated with different limitations, including conservation of natural resources, historical planning decisions and guidance on building. Many of these will have a bearing on how land-based projects can develop, and we’ve included what we consider the most useful datasets in this regard. This information can be used to identify areas where certain developments are likely to be rejected and to identify planning authority cultures towards community projects. It can also be used to find areas of natural beauty which are likely to attract visitors.

datasets.name: Sites of Special Scientific Interest
datasets.description: Sites of Special Scientific Interest (SSSIs) are areas protected under UK law for their biological and/or geological significance. SSSIs support rare and endangered species, habitats and natural features in the UK.

datasets.name: Special Protection Areas
datasets.description: Special Protection Areas (SPAs) are sites protected under EU law, designated for rare and vulnerable birds and for regularly occurring migratory species.

datasets.name: Special Areas of Conservation
datasets.description: Special Areas of Conservation (SACs) are sites protected under EU law, designated as part of a network of high-quality sites contributing to the conservation of natural habitats and of wild fauna and flora.

datasets.name: Planning for the Common Good
datasets.description: This report considers issues land-based social enterprises have in the planning system. It talks about ways in which things could be improved in the current system, and highlights areas to policy change.

datasets.name: Planning guidance
datasets.description: This collects guidance for communities engaging with the planning system around land use.

datasets.name: MAGIC Map
datasets.description: This is the most comprehensive platform displaying land data in the UK. It contains most of the data related to areas with planning restrictions (e.g. National Parks, SSSIs)

datasets.name: Planning Applications API
datasets.description: The Land Insight API has data from local planning authorities across England in a standard format. Use this API in your own software applications. Lookup planning applications by location or keywords.

datasets.name: Planning Aid
datasets.description: Planning Aid offers free, independent advice on planning issues

datasets.name: Chapter 7
datasets.description: Chapter 7, the Planning Office of TLIO, campaigns for a planning system which actively encourages sustainable, low impact and affordable homes. They also give planning advice to people seeking to/or already embarking upon living on the land, engaged in land-based livelihoods.

description: Knowing who owns land is crucial to being able to engage with it. Information on who owns land, and how much that land was sold for, is collected by the Land Registry. We think this information should be free and open access. However for now the data can be accessed on their website by using the INSPIRE ID of a given area and paying a small fee (£3.00 - £6.00). To do so, copy the INSPIRE ID for this area, and paste it into the search box here.

datasets.name: Rural Land Register
datasets.description: This contains information on ownership and boundaries of land for which CAP subsidies are being claimed. Still no confirmation on whether this will be released

datasets.name: Boundary-Line
datasets.description: Boundary-Line is a specialist 1:10 000 scale boundaries dataset. It contains all levels of electoral and administrative boundaries, from district, wards and civil parishes (or communities) up to parliamentary, assembly and European constituencies. The information is represented as vector digital data.

datasets.name: Register of Public Sector Land
datasets.description: Data files from e-PIMS, Government's Property and Land asset database containing details of location, tenure and other key attributes for each asset. It includes details about the buildings, any vacant space and occupiers.

datasets.name: Local Authority Land/Asset Register
datasets.description: Each local authority should maintain a register of its land and building assets.

description:
Drainage (in relation to impacts on soil, ability to build, access etc.). 
Possible uses include:
- Evaluating a site's potential for various activities (e.g. growing, recreation)
- Potential need for investment to improve drainage

datasets.name: Sustainable drainage systems
datasets.description: This national dataset brings together sixteen national datasets to create a GIS product that provides the information necessary to determine the extent to which the ground is suitable for infiltration sustainable drainage systems (SuDS).

datasets.name: OS Open Rivers
datasets.description: High-level view of watercourses in Great Britain

datasets.name: Detailed River Network - Line feature class (AfA036) (Unpublished)
datasets.description: Detailed River Network (DRN) - Line feature class dataset representing the online drainage network of England and Wales. It is a river centreline dataset, based on OS MasterMap for surface features and Environment Agency culvert surveys for underground features (where available). There are many attributes associated with this dataset to enable it to be used for many different business purposes. It is topologically correct to allow it's use in network tracing tasks. This is a spatial dataset.
datasets.notes: Awaiting response on plans for publication

datasets.name: List of Internal Drainage Boards
datasets.description: Internal Drainage Boards (IDBs) are independent locally funded and operated statutory public bodies. There are currently around 100 IDBs in England and the Boards consist of elected members who represent agricultural rate payers and local authority appointed members representing special levy payers in the local community. IDBs are responsible for water level management in areas of special drainage need.

description:
Contamination (e.g. history of use, proximity to waste disposal or other pollutants). 
Possible uses include:
- Ruling out sites (e.g. for Organic production)
- Identifying available subsidies

datasets.name: Air quality framework
datasets.description: This will provide guidelines on how to access data on air quality.

datasets.name: UK-Air
datasets.description: The best source of location-based open data on air quality and air pollution is Defra's UK-AIR site.

datasets.name: Contaminated Land
datasets.description: No description for this dataset, currently awaiting feedback from EA.
datasets.notes: Not yet released but they are looking into it (awaiting response).

datasets.name: Nitrate Vulnerable Zones data
datasets.description: Data on groundwater, surfacewater, and eutrophic water monitoring. Zoning boundaries on Nitrate Vulnerable Zones.

datasets.name: Contaminated Land
datasets.description: All data related to contaminated land projects formerly in the Pollution and Waste Management & Extraction Industry Impacts Programme, now part of Chemical and Biological Hazards Programme. These data include borehole, geological (solid, drift, made ground), geochemical, land use, abstraction, aerial photographic, hydrological and hydrogeological information for a variety of UK landfill sites and sites of surface contamination.

datasets.name: Lots of local datasets on Contaminated Land
datasets.description: Many local authorities have published registers of sites determined as being contaminated. Seem to be in different formats. LAs have a responsibility to publish a contaminated land register

datasets.name: Strategic noise mapping: Noise from road and rail
datasets.description: Defra has published strategic noise map data that give a snapshot of the estimated noise from major road and rail sources across England in 2012

description:
Current use (e.g. activities used for or identifying unused land). 
Possible uses include:
- Identifying likelihood of being able to access land, and likely existing infrastructure

datasets.name: National Forest Inventory
datasets.description: Annual inventories of UK forests, with spatial data and associated metadata. Includes interpreted forest types for all woodland over 0.5ha and Interpreted Open Area info for areas over 0.5ha that are completely surrounded by woodland.

datasets.name: Land Cover Map 2007
datasets.description: Land cover describes the physical material on the surface of the country. For example: grassland, woodland, rivers & lakes and artificial materials such as roads and buildings. Land cover maps have many uses; they are used for the management of natural resources, urban planning, carbon accounting and flood risk modelling, to name but a few.

datasets.name: ITE land classification of Great Britain 2007
datasets.description: The Land Classification 2007 is a classification of Great Britain into a set of 45 environmental strata, termed land classes, to be used as a basis for ecological survey. The strata were created from the multivariate analysis of 75 environmental variables, including climatic data, topographic data, human geographical features and geology data.

datasets.name: CRoW Act 2000 data
datasets.description: Countryside and Rights of Way Act maps - this shows areas designated for public access to the countryside (rights to roam).

datasets.name: Land Use Statistics (Generalised Land Use Database)
datasets.description: A classification has been developed which allocates all identifiable land features on Ordnance Survey MasterMap into nine simplified land categories and an additional 'unclassified' category. These are: domestic buildings, non-domestic buildings, roads, paths, rail, gardens (domestic), green space, water, other land uses.

datasets.name: Derelict Land
datasets.description: Previously developed land that is unused or may be available for redevelopment by land type and Planning Authority.

datasets.name: Environmental Stewardship Scheme Agreement
datasets.description: This has polygons and details of who gets the money.
